title: Public Biodiesel Stations
name: Public Biodiesel Stations
description:
A Map by System

This map contains the locations of biodiesel pumps open to the public across the county. Due to the limit on how many markers can show on the map at one time, you need to zoom in a little bit on your area to see the stations near you.

properties.name: Biofuel Oasis
properties.description: Posted by Biodeva2465 Fourth street Berkeley, CA2465 4th Street @ Dwight Way * Berkeley, CA 94710 | 510.665.5509 HOURS: Mondays: Closed | Sundays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays, & Thursdays: 4:00pm - 8:00pm Fridays: by appointment | Saturdays: 10:00am - 5:00pm Biodiesel: We sell high quality commercial biodiesel that meets ASTM standards. We prefer to sell biodiesel that is made from recycled vegetable oil. We currently sell B99. The price includes sales tax, state excise tax, and federal excise tax. You can pump directly into your car from our fuel station-style pump that\'s California Weights and Measures certified. We also offer fuel in 5 gallon containers called carboys that give you the freedom of fueling whenever and wherever you like. Many of our customers fill up their tanks and then stock up with 10-20 gallons in carboys, so they only come to the Oasis every month or two and minimize their driving to get fuel. The carboys cost for the container plus the cost of the 5 gallons of fuel. BioFuel Oasis was founded in 2003 to provide greater access to biodiesel, a renewable fuel that reduces harmful tailpipe emissions. We are a women/worker-owned & operated cooperative that values sustainability, local production, and community.

properties.name: Dennis K. Burke, Incorporated
properties.description: Posted by SystemBioDiesel Refueling Station, Public - credit card after hours. 410 Beacham Street, Chelsea MA 02150. 800-289-2875. For over 40 years, Dennis K. Burke, Inc. has been reliably delivering premium diesel fuel, motor oil and gasoline to fleets and industry throughout the Massachusetts, New Hampshire and Rhode Island area. While Detroit offers several variations of new Alternative Fuel Vehicles (AFV) that average over 50 miles to the gallon, independent fuel marketers are introducing "Biodiesel," a healthier, renewable energy solution that seems to be meeting just about everyone\'s approval. The Burke Gas Station on Beacham Street in Chelsea is the first station in the state of Massachusetts to offer biodiesel products Biodiesel B20 at the pump and Biodiesel B100 in drums and pails. Biodiesel is a clean, diesel fuel substitute made from soybeans, canola, and recycled cooking oil from restaurants. It can be burned safely in any standard, unmodified diesel engine, either in pure form (B100) or in a 20% blend (B20) with 80% petroleum diesel. Most truck manufacturers recommend using B20 in their engines. Pure biodiesel is completely biodegradable, and poses minimal concerns to soil and water contamination. Biodiesel is also non-toxic to plants, animals and humans. On the performance side, biodiesel\'s higher cetane rating results in excellent engine performance and fuel economy. Biodiesel has outstanding lubricity characteristics. Blend ratios as low as 1% can provide up to 30% more lubricity over conventional diesel fuel. And a higher flash point means it\'s safer to handle. As one of New England\'s largest suppliers of diesel fuel, gasoline and motor oil products, Dennis K. Burke is proud to be first in bringing biodiesel to Massachusetts.

properties.name: Fourth Dimension Fuels
properties.description: Posted by SystemBioDiesel Refueling Station, Public - call ahead. 1395 W American Avenue, Oracle AZ 85623. 520-609-1162 Fourth Dimension Fuels (FDF) is a Southern-Arizona woman-owned microbusiness founded in May 2003 with the goal of bringing biodiesel to the residents and travelers of the tri-community area of Oracle, San Manuel, and Mammoth. The county\'s first, FDF\'s biodiesel pump was opened in May of 2004, with an official grand opening celebration that took place in August 2004, with help from Colleen Crowninshield (Tucson Regional Clean Cities Coalition Coordinator) and special guest Charris Ford (founder of Grassolean Solutions of Telluride, Colorado). Today, in addition to supplying biodiesel, Fourth Dimension Fuels has expanded to: install Greasecar conversion kits, which allow owners of diesel vehicles to power their engines with waste vegetable oil; educate students and community members about biofuels; host the weekly, year-round Oracle Farmer\' Market; and provide access to a wide array of natural and organic foods and household products via the Tucson Cooperative Warehouse. In 2005, Fourth Dimension Fuels plans to host classes in such subjects as Ayurvedic medicine; the benefits of honey and bee pollen; natural building materials; and other subjects taught primarily by community members. Check our calendar for upcoming events.

properties.name: Gas-Up - Blue Ridge Biofuels
properties.description: Posted by SystemBioDiesel Refueling Station, Public 405 Haywood Road, Asheville NC 28806 828-253-1034 Blue Ridge Biofuels Is a worker/community owned business with the objective of bringing education and locally produced clean burning biodiesel to Asheville and Western North Carolina. We currently supply western North Carolina\'s only biodiesel pump and deliver bioheat as a replacement to #2 heating oil. Our distributed biodiesel will soon be produced from area restaurants\' waste vegetable oil and burns cleanly in any diesel engine. Contrary to popular belief, no modification is necessary to use biodiesel in your diesel vehicle or your home furnace. Biodiesel can also replace the home heating oil or kerosene in your home furnace or monitor heater. BRB currently sells biodiesel at a local gas station (Gas-Up) located at 405 Haywood Road in West Asheville, as well as delivering bulk bio-fuels to homes and businesses.

properties.name: Rymes Propane & Oil - Peterborough
properties.description: Posted by SystemBioDiesel Refueling Station, Public - credit card at all times 10 Depot Street, Peterborough NH 03458 603-924-9084 n April, 2004, Rymes Propane and Oil, with the support of the NH Department of Environmental Services, opened five Biodiesel stations and became the first heating supplier in the state of New Hampshire to break into the market for alternative fuel. We currently offer Biodiesel for sale at our pumps in Antrim, Greenfield, Keene, Loudon, and Peterborough. Biodiesel is available wholesale in Antrim and at our North Stratford, NH bulk facility, and we also deliver Biodiesel throughout New England.
